Returns:

getResource

public URL getResource(String path)
                throws MalformedURLException
Get a associated resource per the specified path. The default method will first check for a local file and then load from the class path. If no file is found, null is returned.

Specified by:
getResource in interface ResourceFactory
Parameters:
path - The name or path of the resource
Returns:
The associated URL of the resource
Throws:
MalformedURLException - if the given path is an invalid URL

getResourceAsStream

public InputStream getResourceAsStream(String path)
Get a associated input stream per the specified path. The default method will first check for a local file and then load from the class path. If no file is found, null is returned.

Specified by:
getResourceAsStream in interface ResourceFactory
Parameters:
path - The name or path of the resource
Returns:
The associated input stream of the resource

getResourceAsProperties

public PropertyMap getResourceAsProperties(String path)
                                    throws IOException
Get the associated resource as a PropertyMap per the specified path. This will load the resource per ResourceFactory.getResource(String) and if the resource is not valid, then null is returned. By default, any properties will be auto-substituted by the default substitutions per SubstitutionFactory.getDefaults(). The type of resource is determined by the path. For examples, 'properties' files use a properties resource loader whereas 'xml' files use a XML resource loader. For more information, see PropertyMapFactoryProvider.

Specified by:
getResourceAsProperties in interface ResourceFactory
Parameters:
path - The name or path of the resource
Returns:
The associated list of properties
Throws:
IOException - If an error occurs loading or parsing the resource

getResourceAsProperties

public PropertyMap getResourceAsProperties(String path,
                                           InputStream input)
                                    throws IOException
Get the associated resource as a PropertyMap per the specified path. This will load the resource per the given input stream and if the resource is not valid, then null is returned. By default, any properties will be auto-substituted by the default substitutions per SubstitutionFactory.getDefaults(). The type of resource is determined by the path. For examples, 'properties' files use a properties resource loader whereas 'xml' files use a XML resource loader. For more information, see PropertyMapFactoryProvider.

Specified by:
getResourceAsProperties in interface ResourceFactory
Parameters:
path - The name or path of the resource
input - The associated stream to load
Returns:
The associated list of properties
Throws:
IOException - If an error occurs loading or parsing the resource

getResourceAsProperties

public PropertyMap getResourceAsProperties(String path,
                                           PropertyMap substitutions)
                                    throws IOException
Get the associated resource as a PropertyMap per the specified path. This will load the resource per ResourceFactory.getResource(String) and if the resource is not valid, then null is returned. Any properties will be auto-substituted by the specified substitutions. The type of resource is determined by the path. For examples, 'properties' files use a properties resource loader whereas 'xml' files use a XML resource loader. For more information, see PropertyMapFactoryProvider.

Specified by:
getResourceAsProperties in interface ResourceFactory
Parameters:
path - The name or path of the resource
substitutions - The map of substitutions to replace properties with
Returns:
The associated list of properties
Throws:
IOException - If an error occurs loading or parsing the resource

getResourceAsProperties

public PropertyMap getResourceAsProperties(String path,
                                           InputStream input,
                                           PropertyMap substitutions)
                                    throws IOException
Get the associated resource as a PropertyMap per the specified path. This will load the resource per the given input stream and if the resource is not valid, then null is returned. Any properties will be auto-substituted by the specified substitutions. The type of resource is determined by the path. For examples, 'properties' files use a properties resource loader whereas 'xml' files use a XML resource loader. For more information, see PropertyMapFactoryProvider.

Specified by:
getResourceAsProperties in interface ResourceFactory
